intro: Pedicularis longipedicellata var. longipedicellata, commonly known as the long-stemmed lousewort, is a perennial herb native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic plants. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and showy, spurred flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils at high altitudes. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically significant species in its habitat.
